<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Frighten Undead](/Feats.aspx?ID=3479) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 29</row>

**Archetype** [Undead Slayer](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=174)

**Prerequisites**
[Undead Slayer Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3474)

</column>

---

Your very presence chills creatures of the night down to their core and you can use the spiritual power and faithful life force of religious verses to frighten even [mindless](/Traits.aspx?ID=108) [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). Attempt to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53) an undead target using your [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) modifier instead of your [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) modifier if it's higher. If you use your Religion modifier, the Demoralize action loses the [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) and [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) traits, as your faith connects to the undead on an instinctual level.

<title level="2">Frighten Undead leads to...</title>
[Slayer's Presence](/Feats.aspx?ID=3482)
name: Frighten Undead
